sailpoint.object
Class Difference

java.lang.Object
  sailpoint.tools.xml.AbstractXmlObject
      sailpoint.object.Difference
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, sailpoint.tools.xml.PersistentXmlObject
public class Difference
extends AbstractXmlObject

This class provides a model for a difference between two abstract attributes.

It also provides a set of static methods to compare various classes and calculate differences.

See Also:

setDisplayName

public void setDisplayName(java.lang.String name)

getDisplayName

public java.lang.String getDisplayName()
The display name (or catalog key) of the attribute if one is available. When comparing Identity attributes, this is taken from the ObjectAttribute. When comparing Link attributes, it could be taken from AttributeDefinition of the Schema.

setMulti

public void setMulti(boolean b)

isMulti

public boolean isMulti()
True if this is a multi-valued attribute. The UI might choose to display these in a different way than single valued attributes.

setOldValue

public void setOldValue(java.lang.String v)

getOldValue

public java.lang.String getOldValue()
String representation of the old value. For multi-valued attributes this will be formatted as a CSV, with ellipses (...) at the end if the value extends beyond the maximum size. This is therefore intended only as a summary of the changes and might not be totally accurate.

setNewValue

public void setNewValue(java.lang.String v)

getNewValue

public java.lang.String getNewValue()
String representation of the new value. For multi-valued attributes, the same issues described with _oldValue apply.

stringify

public static java.lang.String stringify(java.lang.Object value,
                                         int maxStringLength)
Render a value as a string. If it is a long string, truncate it and add ellipses. If it is a list, render it as [ el1, el2, ...] and truncate if too long.

stringify

public static java.lang.String stringify(java.lang.Object value)

diffMaps

public static java.util.List<Difference> diffMaps(java.util.Map map1,
                                                  java.util.Map map2,
                                                  java.util.List exclusions,
                                                  int maxStringLength,
                                                  int maxDiff)
Compare two Maps generating a list of Difference objects. It is assumed that flat maps are being dealt with here and don't need to descend into complex child objects, other than compare them for equality.

The exclusion list might contain keys that are to be ignored.

The max value contains a limit, when set this is usually 1 to indicate that it is just checking to see if anything is different.

diffMaps

public static java.util.List<Difference> diffMaps(java.util.Map map1,
                                                  java.util.Map map2)

                                                  java.util.List exclusions,
                                                  int maxStringLength)

equal

public static boolean equal(java.util.Map map1,
                            java.util.Map map2)
Return true if two Maps have differences. Stop as soon as any difference is detected.
